ASP.NET pages execute on the server and generate markup (such as HTML, WML, or XML) that is sent to a desktop or mobile browser. ASP.NET pages use a compiled, event-driven programming model that improves performance and enables the separation of application logic and user interface. ASP.NET pages and XML Web services files created using ASP.NET contain server-side (rather than client-side) logic written in Visual Basic .NET, C# .NET, or any .NET-compatible language. Web applications and XML Web services take advantage of the features of the common language runtime, such as type safety, inheritance, language interoperability, versioning, and integrated security.

A type of display that uses a liquid compound having a polar molecular structure, sandwiched between two transparent electrodes. When an electric field is applied, the molecules align with the field, forming a crystalline arrangement that polarizes the light passing through it. A polarized filter laminated over the electrodes blocks polarized light. In this way, a grid of electrodes can selectively "turn on" a cell, or a pixel, containing the liquid crystal material, turning it dark.

Most current x86-based systems support the use of extended (or "high") ASCII. Extended ASCII allows the eighth bit of each character to identify an additional 128 special symbol characters, foreign-language letters, and graphic symbols.

descripGrp.descrip: A button that identifies a field in a PivotTable or PivotChart report. You can drag the field buttons to change the layout of the report, or click the arrows next to the buttons to change the level of detail displayed in the report.

termGrp.term: ປຸ່ມ​ບ່ອນ​ປ້ອນ​ຂໍ້​ມູນ

descripGrp.descrip: The part of PivotTable or PivotChart view that contains filter fields.

termGrp.term: ເຂດ​ກັ່ນ​ຕອງ

descripGrp.descrip: A field in the filter area that you can use to filter data displayed in PivotTable or PivotChart view. Filter fields perform the same functions as page fields in Microsoft Excel PivotTable reports.

termGrp.term: ບ່ອນ​ກັ່ນ​ຕອງ

descripGrp.descrip: A rank or category assigned to a material resource that denotes functional use but not level of quality. A low-grade resource is not necessarily a low-quality resource.
The faint vertical and horizontal lines that appear in the drawing window when the grid is turned on. You can use grid lines to help position shapes precisely.
A range in an XML list that has been linked to an element in an XML map.

termGrp.term: ຂອບ​ເຂດ​ເຮັດ​ແຜນ​ທີ່​ແລ້ວ

descripGrp.descrip: A file you create on your hard disk or a network share to store OLAP source data for a PivotTable or PivotChart report. Offline cube files allow you to keep working when you are not connected to the OLAP server.

termGrp.term: ໄຟ​ລ໌​ກ້ອນອອ​ຟ​ລາຍ​ນ໌

descripGrp.descrip: Principles that guide developers as they assign responsibilities to software classes and design system behavior. They are most useful when creating collaboration diagrams where messages imply responsibility.
A schedule of task start and finish dates and resource and cost data.
A bookmark that Microsoft Word automatically sets in each document. For example, the \Sel predefined bookmark refers to the current selection or the insertion point.

termGrp.term: ບຸກ​ມາກ​ຄ໌​ກຳ​ນົດ​ມາ​ກ່ອນ

descripGrp.descrip: The degree of excellence, or the desired standards, in a product, process, or project.
To move a task to a lower outline level [to the right] in the Task Name field. When you indent a task, it becomes a subtask of the nearest preceding task at a higher outline level.
A representation of the communication path between actors.

termGrp.term: ​ການຫຍິບ​ເຂົ້າ​ເຫຼັ້ມ

descripGrp.descrip: An actor's interface component through which actors communicate with other actors.
Any one-dimensional (1-D) shape that can be glued between two shapes in a drawing to connect the shapes.

termGrp.term: ຕົວ​ເຊື່ອມ​ຕໍ່

descripGrp.descrip: The part of PivotTable view that contains row fields.

termGrp.term: ບໍ​ລິ​ເວນ​ແຖວ

descripGrp.descrip: To change the dimensions of a shape by dragging one of its handles after it has been selected with the pointer tool.
A small overlap that extends the shape of the upper of two differently colored, abutting objects. A spread extends beyond the area that it knocks out.

A Web site component that presents users with a set of questions specified by the creator of the survey and collects user responses. Results are tallied in a graphical summary. Requires a Web server that is running Windows SharePoint Services.
Any application or process that you want to model. Examples of systems include a computer game, a process for assembling microchips, and a library information system.
One of a set of major and minor fonts that is applied to a file. Theme fonts, theme colors, and theme effects compose a theme.

termGrp.term: ຕົວ​ໜັງ​ສື​ເທມ

termGrp.term: ຂອບ​ເຂດ​ເວ​ລາ

descripGrp.descrip: A special row in a list or table that provides a selection of aggregate functions useful for working with numerical data.
Optional text for a trendline, including either the regression equation or the R-squared value, or both. A trendline label can be formatted and moved; it cannot be sized.

termGrp.term: ປ້າຍບອກ​ເສັ້ນ​ແນວ​ໂນ້ມ

descripGrp.descrip: The quantity of a resource assigned to a task. The maximum units is the maximum number of units available for the resource. For example, if you have three plumbers, the maximum units is 300 percent or three plumbers working full-time.
A chart axis that displays scaled numerical values.
A calendar in widespread use. It was introduced in 1582 A.D. as a revision to the Julian calendar.

termGrp.term: ປະ​ຕິ​ທິນ​ເກ​ຣັກ​ໂກ​ຮຽນ

descripGrp.descrip: An XML structure that consists of a start tag, an end tag, and the information between the tags. Elements can have attributes and can contain other elements.

termGrp.term: ອົງ​ປະ​ກອບ XML

descripGrp.descrip: A switch (\*) or instruction that specifies the capitalization, numeral style, and character formatting that Microsoft Word uses in a field result.

termGrp.term: ປຸ່ມ​ສັບ​ປ່ຽນ​ຮູບ​ແບບ

descripGrp.descrip: Pertaining to information that shows what has actually occurred. For example, the actual start date for a task is the day that the task actually started.
An allowed path from one state to another.
Having a digital signature.

termGrp.term: ເຊັນ​ທາງ​ດິ​ຈິ​ຕອ​ລ​ແລ້ວ

descripGrp.descrip: The number of levels that a task is indented from the top level of the outline. You can indent tasks up to 65,000 levels in Project.

termGrp.term: ລະ​ດັບ​ເຄົ້າ​ໂຄງ

descripGrp.descrip: A group of related tasks that completes a major step in a project.
Conditions you specify to limit which records are included in the result set of a query or filter.

A feature that enables users to build robust, targeted queries that include search operators. The least complex of which are the Boolean operators many users are familiar with. In addition, customers can use advanced operators such as "contains:" or "inanchor:" or "site:" Customers can add operator upon operator and watch their query change in the search box.

termGrp.term: ຊອກ​ຫາ​ຂັ້ນ​ສູງ

descripGrp.descrip: A notification that is displayed to a user when user-defined criteria are met.
Software that enables parents and guardians to customize children's web experiences in order to help protect their safety and privacy online.

termGrp.term: ຄວາມ​ປອດ​ໄພ​ຄອບ​ຄົວ

descripGrp.descrip: A product's settings that enable customers to determine how people who also use the product may interact with them.

termGrp.term: ຄວາມ​ມັກ​ການ​ສື່​ສານ

descripGrp.descrip: To add a video to a blog entry by entering the embed code for the video.

termGrp.term: ຝັງ​ວິ​ດີ​ໂອ​ໃສ່

termGrp.term: ລະ​ຫັດ​ຝັງ​ໃສ່

descripGrp.descrip: A UI element that links to a text box where the user can enter the embed code to add a video to his or her blog.

termGrp.term: ວິ​ດີ​ໂອ​ຝັງ​ໃສ່

descripGrp.descrip: A list of people, invited by the user, that includes the display picture, notes, and tags for each friend.
A module that shows a photo list of your friends and provides for adding, editing, and deleting people from your friends list.
The folder that by default receives new messages.

termGrp.term: ໂຟ​ລ​ເດີ​ກ່ອງ​ເຂົ້າ

descripGrp.descrip: The folder that by default receives new messages.

termGrp.term: ກ່ອງອີເມວເຂົ້າ

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that enables a customer to send a text message to any contact who uses a supported mobile device.

termGrp.term: ການ​ສົ່ງ​ຂໍ້​ຄວາມ​ມື​ຖື

descripGrp.descrip: A tool that enables a user to get another user's attention by shaking the user's conversation window and playing a sound.

termGrp.term: ຕົວສັ່ນເຕືອນ

descripGrp.descrip: The protection of Internet users from phishing fraud, indentity threat, spyware, and malware (malicious software).

termGrp.term: ຄວາມ​ປອດ​ໄພ​ອອນ​ລາຍ​ນ໌

descripGrp.descrip: A UI element that links to a Web page that displays the condition and quality of the service.

termGrp.term: ສະ​ຖາ​ນະ​ການ​ບໍ​ລິ​ການ

descripGrp.descrip: An online scan that examines a hard disk's level of fragmentation.

termGrp.term: ສະ​ແກນ​ການ​ຈູນ​ຫາ

descripGrp.descrip: An animated greeting a customer can send to a contact.

termGrp.term: ການ​ກະ​ພິບ​ຕາ

descripGrp.descrip: The process of publishing photos or blog entries by sending an e-mail message to a service.

termGrp.term: ພິ​ຊ​ຊິງ​ອີ​ເມວ

descripGrp.descrip: To package your publication files by using the Pack and Go Wizard.
The ability of one element to see or refer to another. For one element to send a message to another element, the latter must be visible to the former.

termGrp.term: ຄວາມ​ສາ​ມາດ​ເຫັນ​ໄດ້

descripGrp.descrip: An entity that can be added to your project, such as an image file, sound file, movie file, markup file, code file, font file, 3D object, control, style resource, template resource, brush resource, and so on.
The color or image that appears behind the content of a visual element, for example, behind the text that is displayed in a TextBox control or on your graphical user interface.
An effect that applies a halo of color around the perimeter of an object.
A file that stores an image as graphical objects (lines, circles, polygons) rather than as pixels. Metafiles preserve an image more accurately than pixels when the image is resized.
A page that you can assign to another page to create multiple layers in a drawing.
The size of the finished page of a printed publication, after trimming.
The size of the sheet of paper on which you print the publication, before trimming.
A word or string of characters in a formula that represents a cell, range of cells, formula, or constant value.

termGrp.term: ຊື່​ກຳ​ນົດ​ແລ້ວ

descripGrp.descrip: A name for an Excel table, which is a collection of data about a particular subject that is stored in records (rows) and fields (columns).

termGrp.term: ຊື່​ຕາ​ຕະ​ລາງ

descripGrp.descrip: A display mode that shows as much content as possible by hiding elements such as navigation and toolbars.

termGrp.term: ໂໝດເຕັມໜ້າຈໍ

descripGrp.descrip: When a ribbon is divided into multiple views, any one of the views. Every tab contains functionally related commands and other controls that are organized in groups. Typically, ribbon tabs are labeled.
An effect that applies to the exterior border around each character of your text or shape.

termGrp.term: ເອັບ​ເຝັກ​ເຄົ້າ​ໂຄງ

descripGrp.descrip: An effect that applies to the appearance of the interior of an enclosed text character or other shape.

termGrp.term: ໄຟ​ລ໌ ເອັບ​ເຝັກ

descripGrp.descrip: A file that contains the data that a program will process and store in a destination file.

termGrp.term: ໄຟ​ລ໌​ແຫຼ່ງ​ທີ່​ມາ

descripGrp.descrip: A setting that compensates for the color of light in which a picture was taken. A correct white balance setting makes colors look natural, while an incorrect white balance can result in pictures that have exaggerated colors.

termGrp.term: ຄວາມ​ດຸນ​ດ່ຽງ​ສີ​ຂາວ

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that identifies elements in your file that aren't supported or will behave differently in a different format or previous version of the product.

termGrp.term: ຕົວ​ກວດ​ເບິ່ງ​ຄວາມ​ເຂົ້າ​ກັນ​ໄດ້

descripGrp.descrip: A Microsoft employee who is the primary contact for the business relationship between the customer and Microsoft.

termGrp.term: ຕົວຈັດການບັນຊີ Microsoft

descripGrp.descrip: To change the modality of a conversation from, say, voice call to video, starting from a pop-up notification.
The microphone and speaker on a calling device/phone that allows you to converse with someone without using the handset or headset.
A current attempt by a second party to establish communication with a user.

termGrp.term: ສາຍໂທເຂົ້າ

descripGrp.descrip: To take action to not answer a call. The call goes to voice mail if that service is available.
The person who is calling another person or place.
To accept an incoming telephone call.
A picture made by combining a series of photos into one large picture to provide a complete view of an area or location that cannot fit in a single shot.
The image or avatar someone adds to their profile to represent themselves.
A collection of communications (e-mail, IM, text messaging, voice mail, and so on) between two or more participants.

termGrp.term: ການ​ສົນ​ທະ​ນາ

descripGrp.descrip: A short alphanumeric message that is sent between mobile phones or devices using the SMS protocol.

termGrp.term: ຂໍ້ຄວາມຕົວອັກສອນ

descripGrp.descrip: A short alphanumeric message that is sent between mobile phones or devices using the SMS protocol.
A short alphanumeric message that is sent between mobile phones or devices using the SMS protocol.

Private information that a customer provides to establish their Windows Live ID. This information is separate from the customer's (outward-facing) profile and is never shared without explicit consent.

Private information that a customer provides to establish their Windows Live ID. This information is separate from the customer's (outward-facing) profile and is never shared without explicit consent.
An account where customers manage their payments, dues, invoicing, and contact information for paid Microsoft services. These accounts are managed on the Billing and Account Management website.

termGrp.term: ບັນ​ຊີ​ການ​ສົ່ງ​ບິນ

descripGrp.descrip: Information, such as name, billing address, and payment method, related to paying for account services.

termGrp.term: ຂໍ້​ມູນ​ການ​ສົ່ງ​ບິນ

descripGrp.descrip: A policy that specifies the length of time during which data, documents, and other records must be available for recovery.

termGrp.term: ນະ​ໂຍ​ບາຍ​ວ່າ​ດ້ວຍ​ການ​ເກັບ​ອັກ​ໄດ້

descripGrp.descrip: A communication technology based on short range (4cm or less) wireless data exchange.

termGrp.term: ການສື່ສານຢູ່ໃກ້ສະໜາມ

descripGrp.descrip: A communication technology based on short range (4cm or less) wireless data exchange.
A navigation bar item that links to billing-related information.

termGrp.term: ການ​ສົ່ງ​ບິນ

descripGrp.descrip: The window that displays solutions, projects, and files, as well as access to the commands that pertain to them.
A drop-down button that performs a default action and can also expand to a list of other possible actions.
The computer that manages the OneCare settings for all computers in a OneCare circle.
The computer that manages the OneCare settings for all computers in a OneCare circle.

termGrp.term: ຄອມ​ພິວ​ເຕີ​ຮັບ

descripGrp.descrip: To tap a device screen and hold one's finger or stylus in place.

termGrp.term: ແຕະຄ້າງໄວ້

descripGrp.descrip: A telephone message delivered to a voicemail system.

termGrp.term: ຂໍ້ຄວາມສຽງ

descripGrp.descrip: A program that extends the capabilities of Internet Explorer.

termGrp.term: ສ່ວນ​ຂະ​ຫຍາຍບ​ຣາວ​ເຊີ

descripGrp.descrip: A list or outline of things to be done or considered.
A card, inserted into a portable device, used to store files.

termGrp.term: ແຜ່ນເກັບຂໍ້ມູນ

descripGrp.descrip: A collection of visual elements and sounds for your computer desktop or device User Interface. A theme determines the look of the various visual elements of your User Interface, such as windows, icons, fonts, and colors, and it can include sounds.

An Internet Explorer feature that allows users to surf the Web without leaving a browsing history, cookies or other information on the PC so they can do online banking on a shared computer, for example.
A computer that is part of a OneCare circle but is not a hub PC or a monitor PC. A device PC has no privileges to monitor or make changes to any other computer in the OneCare circle.

A computer that is not the hub PC but that monitors the activity of other computers in the OneCare circle. The OneCare subscription administrator designates which, if any, computers in the circle have monitoring privileges. A monitor PC cannot make changes to any other computer in the OneCare circle.
The sound made by a mobile device or other phone to indicate an incoming call or message, for example, a series of beeps or an audio recording.

termGrp.term: ສຽງໂທເຂົ້າ

descripGrp.descrip: An alert that is set by the user to be activated at a particular time.
A folder that stores the user's graphics, e.g. digital pictures. Many graphic design and photo-editing programs use this location by default to open or save graphic files.

A series of digital-media files that users can subscribe to online, that are sent to their computers and that can then be accessed on demand on the users' reader. The majority of podcasts are available as audio files in MP3 format, syndicated through an RSS (XML) file. Other formats and other types of files, such as video, can also be podcasted.
To monitor an e-mail conversation or newsgroup thread. The headers for messages in a watched conversation appear in a different color, which makes them easier to find in a message list.
An action that removes redundant messages from an e-mail conversation to reduce information overload and improve readability.
A fork within a conversation, where more than one reply was made to a single e-mail and caused a split in the conversation.
An instant message session with multiple parties, exchanged via IM (not through your mobile operator).

termGrp.term: ແຊັດເປັນກຸ່ມ

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that replicates formatting from a source item — such as text in Word, a cell in Excel, a control in Access, or a shape in Publisher — to one or more target items.

termGrp.term: ເຄື່ອງ​ແຕ້ມ​ຮູບ​ແບບ

descripGrp.descrip: To fix an item, such as a tile, library, movie, game, or app, in a given area of the UI, so it is always accessible in that area (e.g., to make a library always visible in the navigation pane).
To remove an item, such as a tile, library, movie, game, or app, from a given area of the UI, to make it inaccessible in that area (e.g. to make a library non-visible in the navigation pane).
A person who manages accounts and determines safety settings.
A Windows Live account that manages a subscription.
The computers that share a OneCare subscription.
The standard display text for mailto: link for sending a link to a page, typically used when asking someone to view but not participate in something.
To locate or come upon through action.
A process by which multiple authors edit a shared document simultaneously, or collaborate effectively even when they are not online at the same time.

termGrp.term: ການ​ເປັນ​ຜູ້​ຂຽນ​ຮ່ວມ

descripGrp.descrip: A client-side cache for documents that are stored on Web servers. Documents are seamlessly replicated from this local cache, and uploaded to servers as required, enabling faster and more robust file access.

termGrp.term: ແຄ​ຊ໌​ເອ​ກະ​ສານ Office

descripGrp.descrip: A frame that contains text, shapes, pictures, or other content. A slide is a digital equivalent to a traditional film slide.
To mark an e-mail conversation so that all current and future messages in the conversation are automatically moved to the Deleted Items folder.
A user's work day hours as specified in Microsoft Office Outlook by the day of the week and the start and end times.

termGrp.term: ຊົ່ວ​ໂມງ​ເຮັດ​ວຽກ

descripGrp.descrip: To create a sound, vibration, visual cue, or any other indication that the user has an incoming call.

termGrp.term: ເຮັດສຽງດັງ

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that allows the user to apply custom or default markers to items (e.g. Outlook messages or OneNote content) in order to categorize information for easy retrieval and sorting.
A feature that allows the user to apply custom or default markers to items (e.g. Outlook messages or OneNote content) in order to categorize information for easy retrieval and sorting.
A feature in Internet Explorer that helps detect phishing websites and can help protect you from installing malicious software or malware.
The process of creating and sending text messages between or to mobile phones and devices using the SMS protocol.

termGrp.term: ການ​ສົ່ງ​ຂໍ້​ຄວາມ

descripGrp.descrip: An option in Microsoft Virtual Earth that allows the user to view an object in a 45-degree angle from above in bird's eye view.

A radio navigation system developed by the U.S. Department of Defense that uses a constellation of 24 earth satellites, which are monitored by ground-based control stations, to provide precise, continuous worldwide positioning and timing information.
The process of maintaining connectivity outside of one's usual service or coverage area.
A connection that enables the transmission of data.

termGrp.term: ການເຊື່ອມຕໍ່ຂໍ້ມູນ

descripGrp.descrip: A call that originates from your mobile device.
A collaborative action, such as sharing, calendar sharing, or using a whiteboard.
An item on the user's Status menu. A user can select this status to indicate that they are not actively using their computer.
A menu item that enables the user to add a word marked as a misspelling to the dictionary used by the spelling checker.

termGrp.term: ເພີ່ມ​ໃສ່​ພົດ​ຈະ​ນາ​ນຸ​ກົມ

descripGrp.descrip: E-mail that a customer does not want delivered to their inbox, including spam and phishing messages (identified by the mail service) and messages from blocked senders and domains.

termGrp.term: ອີ​ເມວ​ຂີ້​ເຫຍື້ອ

descripGrp.descrip: E-mail that a customer does not want delivered to their inbox, including spam and phishing messages (identified by the mail service) and messages from blocked senders and domains.
An e-mail filter that enables the user to set the strictness level that keeps junk e-mail from being delivered to their Inbox.

termGrp.term: ຕົວ​ກັ່ນ​ຕອງ​ອີ​ເມວ​ຂີ້​ເຫຍື້ອ

descripGrp.descrip: The default version that includes drag-and-drop functionality, right-click menus, and a reading pane.
The version that uses checkboxes and does not include a reading pane. It is recommneded for users with a slow internet connection.

termGrp.term: ລຸ້ນ​ຄ​ລາ​ສິກ

descripGrp.descrip: A set of colors and background images that lets users change the appearance of Windows Live pages. The theme is common to all pages, except for group, event, and space pages, which may each have their own theme.
To copy something from a computer to a location online, such as a photo album or a blog post.

termGrp.term: ຕີ​ພິມ​ເຜີຍ​ແຜ່

descripGrp.descrip: Parental consent for a child to use a Windows Live service, view a website, or communicate with a person.

termGrp.term: ການ​ອະ​ນຸ​ຍາດ

descripGrp.descrip: A content element a user can add to their space.
A SmartArt graphic layout type that includes layouts designed to show nonsequential information.
A SmartArt graphic layout type that includes layouts designed to show steps in a process or timeline.
A SmartArt graphic layout type that includes layouts designed to show a continual process.
A SmartArt graphic layout type that includes layouts designed to show a hierarchical structure, such as an organization chart, or a decision tree.
A SmartArt graphic layout type that includes layouts designed to illustrate connections.
A SmartArt graphic layout type that includes layouts designed to show how parts relate to a whole.
A SmartArt graphic layout type that includes layouts designed to show proportional relationships with the largest component on the top or bottom.
The overall design of a page or content set, including text elements, controls, and graphics.

A post, comments, and responses made within a conversation space, such as a message board, help board, community, newsgroup, or blog. These exchanges are usually publicly viewable. Participation may require credentials, such as a Windows Live ID.

termGrp.term: ການ​ສົນ​ທະ​ນາ

descripGrp.descrip: The descriptive information about a user that is shown to other users. This editable information is separate from the registration information they provide to establish their Windows Live account. This separation allows users to disclose or conceal personal information as they choose.
An answer that only the user knows for a specific question. The answer is used to confirm someone's identity if they forget their password.

A security type that helps prevent unauthorized persons from discerning that a user is going to the Windows Live sign-in page. Otherwise, an unauthorized person might be able to intercept and manipulate the code on the sign-in page, which could result in user information being transmitted to an unauthorized website.

termGrp.term: ຄວາມ​ປອດ​ໄພ​ທີ່​ເພີ່ມ​ແລ້ວ

descripGrp.descrip: An e-mail address to which password reset information can be sent if a customer forgets the password portion of their Windows Live ID.

termGrp.term: ທີ່​ຢູ່​ອີ​ເມວ​ສຳ​ຮອງ

descripGrp.descrip: A customized message that someone sets in Windows Live Messenger, on Windows Live Home, or on their profile page. The status message is part of the "share anything" control. The information is distributed to any connected service.

termGrp.term: ຂໍ້​ຄວາມ​ສ່ວນ​ຕົວ

descripGrp.descrip: A function that allows a user to call a computer.

termGrp.term: ໂທ​ທາງ​ຄອມ​ພິວ​ເຕີ

descripGrp.descrip: A menu item that enables users to initiate operations, such as sending an instant message or playing a game.

A horizontal grouping of actions that apply to the container (or containers) with which the toolbar is associated. For example, a container in which mail is viewed might have an action toolbar with options that include Reply, Delete, and Move to.

termGrp.term: ແຖບ​ເຄື່ອງ​ມື

descripGrp.descrip: A recognition feature that helps increase input speed and reduce effort by providing users with word completion and next word prediction alternates as the user is writing/typing.

termGrp.term: ການເດົາຂໍ້ຄວາມ

descripGrp.descrip: The worldwide collection of networks and gateways that use the TCP/IP suite of protocols to communicate with one another.
The worldwide collection of networks and gateways that use the TCP/IP suite of protocols to communicate with one another.

termGrp.term: ອິນ​ເຕີ​ເນັດ

descripGrp.descrip: To make an object, such as a file, accessible.
An effect that a user can apply to an image to achieve a specific artistic look.

termGrp.term: ເອັບ​ເຝັກ​ສິ​ລະ​ປະ

descripGrp.descrip: An image editing feature that allows a user to isolate the foreground portion of an image and make the background transparent.

termGrp.term: ການ​ກຳ​ຈັດ​ພື້ນ​ຫຼັງ

descripGrp.descrip: The process of adding geospatial metadata (e.g. longitude, latitude) to media (e.g. Websites, RSS feeds, or images).

termGrp.term: ການແທັກທາງດ້ານພູມສາດ

descripGrp.descrip: The portion of InfoPath used to design forms.
To remove a user's changes from the Microsoft Office Document Cache without deleting the file on the server or removing the latest version downloaded from the server from the Office Document Cache.

termGrp.term: ລຶບ​ການ​ປ່ຽນ​ແປງ​ຖິ້ມ

descripGrp.descrip: The checkbox that enables or disables the playing of a sound when a nudge is received.
A feature that allows end users and IT admins to control which file types and versions can be opened and saved in the application.

termGrp.term: ໄຟ​ລ໌ ບ​ລັອກ

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that allows the user to superimpose a dot over a presentation and control its position with the mouse. The appearance of the dot is similar to that of a traditional laser pointer, and it is broadcast to all presentation viewers and can be recorded into video (Save to Video).

termGrp.term: ປາຍ​ຊີ້​ເລ​ເຊີ

descripGrp.descrip: An option that initiates an e-mail response addressed to all of the recipients on the To or Cc lines of the original message.

termGrp.term: ຕອບ​ຄືນ​ຫາທັງ​ໝົດ

descripGrp.descrip: An option that initiates an e-mail response addressed to all of the recipients on the To or Cc lines of the original message.

termGrp.term: ຕອບ​ຄືນ​ທັງ​ໝົດ

descripGrp.descrip: To remove data permanently from a storage medium. This is usually done by replacing existing data with zeros or meaningless text or, in magnetic media, by disturbing the magnetic particles' physical arrangement, either with the erase head or with a large magnet.
A note that contains recorded information.

termGrp.term: ໄຟລ໌ບັນທຶກສຽງ

descripGrp.descrip: A labeled group of consecutive slides that helps the user navigate and organize presentations.
To establish a Bluetooth link or connection between two Bluetooth–enabled devices.
To make a single file out of a set of files using a program such as compress, gzip, or PKZIP.
A radio network that provides coverage for cellular telephone communications.

A type of account that allows customers to use a limited set of Windows Live services without signing up for a new e-mail address or providing an existing alternate one. The ID that is created can't be used to send or receive e-mail. A customer with this account type can only reset their password if they subsequently add an alternate e-mail address to their account.

termGrp.term: ບັນ​ຊີ​ຈຳ​ກັດ

descripGrp.descrip: An account that has restricted functionality. In Windows Live, these accounts are designed for children under the age of 13 and provide a limited set of features. For example, restricted accounts don't have permission to synchronize libraries across computers.

termGrp.term: ບັນ​ຊີ​ຈຳ​ກັດ

descripGrp.descrip: A helper bot for Windows Live Messenger that was developed on the Windows Live Agents platform.

A full-page UI view that exposes file-level functionality in Office applications. This is a companion feature to the Office Ribbon and helps users discover and use the features that fall outside of the authoring features on the Ribbon.
A list of the alerts that a Windows Live Messenger customer has received.

termGrp.term: ປະ​ຫວັດ​ການ​ເຕືອນ

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that allows someone to manage their Windows Live alerts.

termGrp.term: ຕົວ​ຈັດ​ການ​ເຕືອນ

descripGrp.descrip: A personal web presence provided by the Windows Live Spaces service.
A display picture that can be customized and may be animated.

termGrp.term: ຮູບ​ສະ​ແດງ​ໄດ​ນາ​ມິກ

descripGrp.descrip: A list of messages that you have sent or received.

termGrp.term: ປະ​ຫວັດ​ຂໍ້​ຄວາມ

descripGrp.descrip: An instant message that is transmitted while the sender or recipient is offline.

termGrp.term: ຂໍ້​ຄວາມ​ດ່ວນອອ​ຟ​ລາຍນ໌

descripGrp.descrip: An ID that allows someone to sign in to a non-Microsoft website that uses the Windows Live ID service.

termGrp.term: ID ຫຸ້ນ​ສ່ວນ

descripGrp.descrip: The helper program that can store sign-in information for multiple Windows Live IDs.

termGrp.term: ຕົວ​ຊ່ວຍ​ລົງ​ຊື່​ເຂົ້າ​ໃຊ້ Windows Live

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that offers improved security by loading a document in a read-only view, rather than in the full editor, for scenarios that pose a greater potential security risk.

termGrp.term: ມຸມມອງ​ຖືກ​ປົກ​ປ້ອງ​ໄວ້

descripGrp.descrip: A file, similar to a video clip, that contains a short audio segment that a user records to send to a contact. The clip appears in the contact's conversation window and plays automatically.
A list that displays someone's recent activity on Windows Live.
The contact picture label that indicates someone has been invited to do something, but has not responded yet.
The link to the webpage where a user manages photos and albums.
The link to the main landing/start page on Windows Live.
A set of attributes that define a user's access to a given service or application.
To break a connection.

termGrp.term: ຕັດການເຊື່ອມຕໍ່

descripGrp.descrip: To call the last person called from a phone or device.
To send text messages from a mobile phone or device.

termGrp.term: ສົ່ງຂໍ້ຄວາມ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression, a timeline, or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Works well for illustrating both Level 1 and Level 2 text.

termGrp.term: ​ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ເນັ້ນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show groups of information or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Emphasizes the interaction or relationships among the groups of information.

termGrp.term: ການ​ໄຫຼ​ສະ​ຫຼັບ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show either related or contrasting concepts with some connection, such as opposing forces. The first two lines of Level 1 text are used for text in the arrows. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ເສັ້ນ​ລູກ​ສອນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to compare or show the relationship between two ideas. Each of the first two lines of Level 1 text corresponds to text at the top of one side of the center point. Emphasizes Level 2 text, which is limited to four shapes on each side of the center point. The balance tips towards the side with the most shapes containing Level 2 text. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.
A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes.

termGrp.term: ​ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ງໍ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes.

termGrp.term: ບັນ​ຊີບ​ລັອກ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression; a timeline; sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow; or to emphasize movement or direction. Level 1 text appears inside an arrow shape while Level 2 text appears below the arrow shapes.

termGrp.term: ​ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ຮູບ​ຕົວ​ວີ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Emphasizes the stages or steps rather than the connecting arrows or flow. Works best with Level 1 text only.

termGrp.term: ວົງ​ມົນ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show the relationship of components to a whole in quadrants. The first four lines of Level 1 text appear in the quadrants. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ແມ​ຕ​ຣິກ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show how individual parts form a whole. The first seven lines of Level 1 text correspond to the evenly distributed wedge or pie shapes. The top Level 1 text shape appears outside of the rest of the pie for emphasis. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ຮູບ​ພາຍ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow.

termGrp.term: ​ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show proportional, interconnected, or hierarchical relationships with the largest component on the bottom and narrowing up. Level 1 text appears in the pyramid segments and Level 2 text appears in shapes alongside each segment.

termGrp.term: ປີ​ຣາ​ມິດ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show the relationship to a central idea in a cycle. The first line of Level 1 text corresponds to the central shape, and its Level 2 text corresponds to the surrounding circular shapes. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ການ​ກົດ​ຊ້ຳ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show containment, gradations, or hierarchical relationships. The first five lines of Level 1 text are associated with a circle. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ເປົ້າ​ໝາຍ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow, or to show timeline information. Works well with both Level 1 and Level 2 text.

termGrp.term: ເສັ້ນ​ເວ​ລາ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show overlapping or interconnected relationships. The first seven lines of Level 1 text correspond with a circle. If there are four or fewer lines of Level 1 text, the text is inside the circles. If there are more than four lines of Level 1 text, the text is outside of the circles. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ແຜນ​ຜັງ​ຊ້ອນ​ທັບ​ພື້ນ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. The small circular shapes are designed to contain pictures. Works well for illustrating both Level 1 and Level 2 text. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes.

termGrp.term: ບັນ​ຊີ​ເນັ້ນ​ຮູບ​ການ​ງໍ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Emphasizes the stages or steps rather than the connecting arrows or flow.

termGrp.term: ວົງ​ມົນ​ບ​ລັອກ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression through several processes that make up an overall workflow. Also works for illustrating contrasting processes. The Level 1 text corresponds to the first arrow shape on the left, while the Level 2 text corresponds to horizontal sub-steps for each shape that contains Level 1 text.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ຮູບ​ຕົວ​ວີ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a long or non-linear sequence or steps in a task, process, or workflow. Works best with Level 1 text only. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes.

termGrp.term: ​ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ງໍ​ເປັນ​ວົງ​ມົນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression, a timeline, or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow, or to emphasize movement or direction. Can be used to emphasize information in the starting shape. Works best with Level 1 text only.

termGrp.term: ​ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ຮູບ​ຕົວ​ວີ​​ປິດ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a timeline or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Works best with Level 1 text because each line of Level 1 text appears inside the arrow shape. Level 2 text appears outside the arrow shape.

termGrp.term: ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ລູກ​ສອນ​ຕໍ່​ເນື່ອງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Works best with minimal Level 1 and Level 2 text.

termGrp.term: ​ຂະ​ບວນ​ການບ​ລັອກ​ຕໍ່​ເນື່ອງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Emphasizes the connection between all components. Works best with Level 1 text only.

termGrp.term: ວົງ​ມົນ​ຕໍ່​ເນື່ອງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show groups of interconnected information. The circular shapes are designed to contain pictures.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ຮູບ​ຕໍ່​ເນື່ອງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show ideas or concepts that converge to a central point. Works best with Level 1 text only.

termGrp.term: ລູກ​ສອນ​ເຂົ້າ​ມາ​ຕໍ່ກັນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show relationships of concepts or components to a central idea in a cycle. The first line of Level 1 text corresponds to the central circular shape and the lines of Level 2 text correspond to the surrounding rectangular shapes. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ການ​ກົດ​ຊ້ຳ​ເຂົ້າ​ມາ​ຕໍ່​ກັນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show two opposing ideas or concepts. Each of the first two lines of Level 1 text corresponds to an arrow and works well with Level 2 text. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ລູກ​ສອນ​ດຸນ​ດ່ຽງ​ເຄື່ອງ​ນັບ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show the relationship to a central idea in a cyclical progression. Each of the first four lines of Level 1 text corresponds to a wedge or pie shape, and Level 2 text appears in a rectangular shape to the side of the wedge or pie shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ແມ​ຕ​ຣິກ​ວົງ​ມົນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used with large amounts of Level 2 text to show a progression through stages.

termGrp.term: ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ລະ​ອຽດ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show ideas or concepts that progress outward from a central source. Works best with Level 1 text only.

termGrp.term: ລູກ​ສອນ​ປ່ຽນ​ທິດ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show relationships to a central idea in a cycle. The first Level 1 line of text corresponds to the central circular shape. Emphasizes the surrounding circles rather than the central idea. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ການ​ໂທ​ຄືນ​ປ່ຽນ​ທິດ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show sequential steps or tasks that depict a plan or result. The last Level 1 line of text appears after the equals sign (=).Works best with Level 1 text only.

A SmartArt graphic layout used to show the filtering of information or how parts merge into a whole. Emphasizes the final outcome. Can contain up to four lines of Level 1 text; the last of these four Level 1 text lines appears below the funnel and the other lines correspond to a circular shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

A SmartArt graphic layout used to show interlocking ideas. Each of the first three lines of Level 1 text corresponds to a gear shape, and their corresponding Level 2 text appears in rectangles next to the gear shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

A SmartArt graphic layout used to show the placement of concepts along two axes. Emphasizes the individual components rather than the whole. The first four lines of Level 1 text appear in the quadrants. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ແມ​ຕ​ຣິກ​ຫ້ອງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show groups and sub-groups of information, or steps and sub-steps in a task, process, or workflow. Level 1 text corresponds to the top-level horizontal shapes, and Level 2 text corresponds to vertical sub-steps under each related top-level shape. Works well for emphasizing sub-groups or sub-steps, hierarchical information, or multiple lists of information.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ຊື່​ຈັດ​ກຸ່ມ​ແລ້ວ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show hierarchical relationships progressing from top to bottom.
A SmartArt graphic layout used to show hierarchical relationships progressing across groups. Can also be used to group or list information.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ລຳ​ດັບ​ຂັ້ນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show non-sequential or grouped lists of information. Works well with large amounts of text. All text has the same level of emphasis, and direction is not implied.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ບູ​ລ​ເລັດ​ລວງ​ຂວາງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show hierarchical relationships progressing horizontally. Works well for decision trees.

termGrp.term: ລຳ​ດັບ​ຂັ້ນ​ລວງ​ຂວາງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show non-sequential or grouped information with an emphasis on related pictures. The top shapes are designed to contain pictures.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ຊື່​ຮູບ​ລ​ວງ​ຂວາງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show hierarchical relationships progressing horizontally and grouped hierarchically. Emphasizes heading or level 1 text. The first line of Level 1 text appears in the shape at the beginning of the hierarchy, and the second and all subsequent lines of Level 1 text appear at the top of the tall rectangles.

termGrp.term: ລຳ​ດັບ​ຂັ້ນ​ຕິດ​ສະ​ຫຼາກ​ໄວ້​ລ​ວງ​ຂວາງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show proportional, or interconnected, or hierarchical relationships with the largest component on the top and narrowing down. Level 1 text appears in the pyramid segments and Level 2 text appears in shapes alongside each segment.

termGrp.term: ປີ​ຣາ​ມິດ​ລວງ​ປີ້ນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show hierarchical relationships progressing from top to bottom and grouped hierarchically. Emphasizes heading or level 1 text. The first line of Level 1 text appears in the shape at the beginning of the hierarchy, and all subsequent lines of Level 1 text appear to the left of the tall rectangles.

termGrp.term: ລຳ​ດັບ​ຂັ້ນ​ໝາຍ​ໄວ້

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show overlapping relationships in a sequence. Works best with Level 1 text only.

termGrp.term: ແຜນ​ຜັງ​ວາງ​ຊ້ອນ​ຕາມ​ເສັ້ນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events that can occur in any direction.

termGrp.term: ວົງ​ມົນ​ຫຼາຍ​ທິດ​ທາງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show containment relationships. Each of the first three lines of Level 1 text correspond to the upper left text in the shapes, and Level 2 text corresponds to the smaller shapes. Works best with minimal Level 2 lines of text. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ເປົ້າ​ໝາຍ​ປະ​ສານ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Each shape has the same level of importance. Works well when direction does not need to be indicated.

termGrp.term: ວົງ​ມົນ​ບໍ່​ມີ​ທິດ​ທາງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show two opposing ideas, or ideas that diverge from a central point. Each of the first two lines of Level 1 text corresponds to an arrow. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ລູກ​ສອນ​ກົງ​ກັນ​ຂ້າມ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show hierarchical information or reporting relationships in an organization. The assistant shape and the Org Chart hanging layouts are available with this layout.

termGrp.term: ໂຄງ​ຮ່າງ​ການ​ຈັດ​ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show grouped or related information. The small shapes on the upper corners are designed to contain pictures. Emphasizes Level 2 text over Level 1 text, and is a good choice for large amounts of Level 2 text.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ເນັ້ນ​ຮູບ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. The rectangular shapes in the background are designed to contain pictures.

termGrp.term: ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ເນັ້ນ​ຮູບ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. The top shapes are designed to contain pictures and pictures are emphasized over text. Works well for pictures with short text captions.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ຄຳ​ອະ​ທິ​ບາຍ​ຮູບ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show information illustrating a process or workflow. Level 1 text appears in the circular shapes and Level 2 text appears in the arrow shapes. Works best for minimal text and to emphasize movement or direction.

termGrp.term: ລູກ​ສອນ​ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show multiple groups of information or steps and sub-steps in a task, process, or workflow. Level 1 text corresponds to the top horizontal shapes, and Level 2 text corresponds to vertical sub-steps under each related top-level shape.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show proportional, interconnected, or hierarchical relationships. Text appears in the rectangular shapes on top of the pyramid background

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ຊື່​ປີ​ຣາ​ມິດ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show the relationship to a central idea. Emphasizes both information in the center circle and how information in the outer ring of circles contributes to the central idea. The first Level 1 line of text corresponds to the central circle, and its Level 2 text corresponds to the outer ring of circles. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ຮອບ​ວຽນ​ກົດ​ຊ້ຳ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show relationships to a central idea in a cycle. The center shape can contain a picture. Level 1 text appears in the smaller circles and any related Level 2 text appears to the side of the smaller circles.

termGrp.term: ບັນ​ຊີ​ກົດ​ຊ້ຳ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show both overlapping relationships and the relationship to a central idea in a cycle. The first line of Level 1 text corresponds to the central shape and the lines of Level 2 text correspond to the surrounding circular shapes. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ແຜນ​ຜັງກົດ​ຊ້ຳ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes. Does not emphasize directionality.

termGrp.term: ການ​ຊ້ຳ​ຂະ​ບວນ​ກາ​ນ​ງໍ​ຄືນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression or a sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Emphasizes the interconnected pieces. Each of the first seven lines of Level 1 text corresponds to a wedge or pie shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ວົງ​ມົນ​ແຍກ​ສ່ວນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Emphasizes Level 2 text, since each line appears in a separate shape.

termGrp.term: ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ແຍກ​ສ່ວນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show containment, proportional, or interconnected relationships. The first nine lines of Level 1 text appear in the triangular shapes. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts. Works best with Level 1 text only.

termGrp.term: ປີ​ຣາ​ມິດ​ແຍກ​ສ່ວນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show groups of information or steps in a task, process, or workflow. Circular shapes contain Level 1 text, and the corresponding rectangles contain Level 2 text. Works well for numerous details and minimal Level 1 text.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການກອງ​ຂຶ້ນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a downward progression through stages. Each of the first five lines of Level 1 text corresponds with a rectangle. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ເຫຼື່ອມ​ກັນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show groups of information built from top to bottom, and the hierarchies within each group. This layout does not contain connecting lines.

termGrp.term: ລຳ​ດັບ​ຂັ້ນ​ຕາ​ຕະ​ລາງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show grouped or related information of equal value. The first Level 1 line of text corresponds to the top shape and its Level 2 text is used for the subsequent lists.

termGrp.term: ບັນ​ຊີ​ຕາ​ຕະ​ລາງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show interrelated or overlapping information. Each of the first seven lines of Level 1 text appears in the rectangular shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts. Works well with both Level 1 and Level 2 text.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ຊື່​ເປົ້າ​ໝາຍ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Emphasizes the arrows or flow rather than the stages or steps. Works best with Level 1 text only.

termGrp.term: ວົງ​ມົນ​ຂໍ້​ຄວາມ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show the relationships of four quadrants to a whole. The first line of Level 1 text corresponds to the central shape, and the first four lines of Level 2 text appear in the quadrants. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ແມ​ຕ​ຣິກ​ມີ​ຫົວ​ຂໍ້ແລ້ວ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show grouped or related information of equal value. Works well with large amounts of text.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ຮູບ​ຄາງ​ໝູ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression or steps that trend upward in a task, process, or workflow. Each of the first five lines of Level 1 text corresponds to a point on the arrow. Works best with minimal text. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ລູກ​ສອນ​ຂຶ້ນ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow that move toward a common goal. Works well for bulleted lists of information.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ລູກ​ສອນ​ລວງ​ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes. Places more emphasis on the interrelationships among the shapes than on direction or movement.

termGrp.term: ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ງໍ​ລວງ​ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show groups of information or steps in a task, process, or workflow. Works well with large amounts of Level 2 text. A good choice for text with a main point and multiple sub-points.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການບ​ລັອກ​ລວງ​ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show several groups of information, especially groups with large amounts of Level 2 text. A good choice for bulleted lists of information.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​​ການ​ກ່ອງ​ລວງ​ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. Works well for lists with long headings or top-level information.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ບູ​ລ​ເລັດ​ລວງ​ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow, or to emphasize movement or direction. Emphasizes Level 2 text over Level 1 text, and is a good choice for large amounts of Level 2 text.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ຮູບ​ຕົວ​ວີ​ລວງ​ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show sequential steps or tasks that depict a plan or result. The last Level 1 line of text appears after the arrow. Works best with Level 1 text only.

termGrp.term: ສົມ​ຜົນ​ລວງ​ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. The small circles are designed to contain pictures.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ເນັ້ນ​ຮູບ​ລວງ​ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. The small shapes on the left are designed to contain pictures.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ຮູບ​ລວງ​ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow from top to bottom. Works best with Level 1 text, since the vertical space is limited.

termGrp.term: ຂະ​ບວນ​ການ​ລວງ​ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: A SmartArt graphic layout used to show overlapping relationships. A good choice for emphasizing growth or gradation. Works best with Level 1 text only. The first seven lines of Level 1 text correspond to a circular shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

termGrp.term: ແຜນ​ຜັງ​ກອງ​ຂຶ້ນ

descripGrp.descrip: To reject or turn off a system notification such as a reminder, a new message alert or an alarm.
A telephone call the user has failed to answer.

termGrp.term: ສາຍບໍ່ໄດ້ຮັບ

descripGrp.descrip: As set of rules defined by the administrator. For example, the policy may require all users to change their passwords.
A company that provides services or content for its customers.

termGrp.term: ຜູ້ໃຫ້ບໍລິການ

descripGrp.descrip: A Windows Phone application that is both a digital still camera and a digital video camera.

termGrp.term: ກ້ອງຖ່າຍຮູບ

descripGrp.descrip: An occurrence, activity or happening of significance that occurs.
The on-screen representation of the phone keypad or dial pad on the device.
The mechanical part that makes the phone ring to indicate an incoming call.

termGrp.term: ເຄື່ອງເຮັດສຽງດັງ

descripGrp.descrip: A type of personal identification number (PIN) for the SIM card, consisting of 4 digits, that is used to gain access to your mobile phone.

The administrative task of making remote resources available to its users, setting policies that control how users will connect, how they will find the remote resources, and what settings users will connect with.

termGrp.term: ການ​ເຜີຍ​ແຜ່

descripGrp.descrip: An Internet site that provides a collection of products and services developed by Microsoft partners for Microsoft Office users.
To remove a Bluetooth link or connection between two Bluetooth–enabled devices.
An Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) 802.11 wireless network in which Service Set Identifier (SSID) suppression is enabled.

termGrp.term: ເຄືອ​ຂ່າຍ​ເຊື່ອງ​ໄວ້

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that prevents Internet Explorer from storing data about your browsing session. This helps prevent anyone else who might be using your computer from seeing where you visited and what you looked at on the Web.

termGrp.term: ການ​ທ່ອງ​ເບິ່ງ InPrivate

descripGrp.descrip: An image and color combination designed to personalize a display window that is viewable to other people. For example, in Windows Live Messenger, someone can choose from a set of available scenes, or upload their own background image. They can also use a default color suggestion, or specify their own color. Someone's personalization is displayed in the main Messenger window (visible to themselves) and also in the main conversation window (visible to others).
The link group that includes links to the About Hotmail webpage, the What's New webpage, and so on.
A contact that someone has tagged in Messenger to appear in the group of "favorite contacts" that appears at the top of the Messenger display window.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ຊື່​ຕິດ​ຕໍ່​ທີ່​ມັກ

descripGrp.descrip: The API that defines a set of web services which can programmatically access the Windows Live Contacts Address Book database.
The Windows Live service for event planning and invitations.
The set of Windows Live services optimized for use on mobile devices running Windows Mobile.

termGrp.term: Windows Live ສຳ​ລັບ Windows Mobile

descripGrp.descrip: The Windows Live webpage that displays security and safety-related activities.
The OneCare software designed to run on supported servers.

termGrp.term: Windows Live OneCare ສຳ​ລັບ​ເຊີບ​ເວີ

descripGrp.descrip: The link that appears above an incomplete content set and leads to the full list of items. For example, when a content module displays items 1–6, a "View all" link in line with the module label leads to a webpage that lists all items. The items that are available in preview are redundantly available in the list of all items, which may be paginated.

termGrp.term: ເບິ່ງ​ທັງ​ໝົດ

descripGrp.descrip: A webpage link saved as a .url file in someone's "Shared favorites" folder. For example, shared favorites can be created directly within OneDrive, or via the Windows Live Toolbar.

termGrp.term: ລາຍ​ການ​ທີ່​ມັກ​ແຊ​ຣ໌​ແລ້ວ

descripGrp.descrip: The image that appears in the conversation window.
A contribution or feedback left by someone viewing content on a site. Someone who views a space, photos, or files can leave a comment, if permissions allow it.
To apply a marker to content or items (like photos or text) to identify certain types of information.
A mobile phone number and PIN. Adding mobile credentials to an account makes it easier for the account holder to sign in on their mobile device.

termGrp.term: ໃບ​ຮັບ​ຮອງ​ມື​ຖື

descripGrp.descrip: A calendar that displays all of the birthdays stored in someone's contact list.

termGrp.term: ປະ​ຕິ​ທິນ​ວັນ​ເກີດ

descripGrp.descrip: A calendar for a group.

termGrp.term: ປະ​ຕິ​ທິນ​ກຸ່ມ

descripGrp.descrip: A website whose content is understandable and usable by kids and that is appropriate for them. The language is typically aimed at a grade-school reading level, and the concepts presented are accessible to younger minds.

termGrp.term: ເວັບໄຊ​ທ໌ທີ່​ດີ​ກັບ​ເດັກ

descripGrp.descrip: A website whose content is understandable and usable by kids and that is appropriate for them. The language is typically aimed at a grade-school reading level, and the concepts presented are accessible to younger minds.

termGrp.term: ເວັບ​ໄຊ​ທ໌​ທີ່​ດີ​ກັບ​ເດັກ

descripGrp.descrip: The tab on the Family Safety website that displays requests a child has made via e-mail to view a blocked website.

termGrp.term: ການ​ຂໍ​ເວັບ​ໄຊ​ທ໌

descripGrp.descrip: The tab on the Family Safety website that displays requests a child has made via e-mail to have new contacts added.

termGrp.term: ການ​ຂໍ​ລາຍ​ຊື່​ຕິດ​ຕໍ່

descripGrp.descrip: A method of blocking access to websites based on their content. For example, In Windows Live Family Safety, parents can specify a filtering level, such as Strict or Basic, for their child.

termGrp.term: ການກ​ກັ່ນ​ຕອງ​ເວັບ

descripGrp.descrip: The panel item the image-leveling feature in Windows Live Photo Gallery. When the item is clicked, the feature automatically adjusts the photo according to its best interpretation of the horizontal axis. It also displays a slider, which allows someone to make further adjustments. The photo is automatically cropped as needed.

termGrp.term: ຢືດ​ຮູບ​ຖ່າຍ

descripGrp.descrip: To adjust the axis of a photo so that objects in the photo appear level, typically with use of an image editing tool.

termGrp.term: ຢືດ​ຮູບ​ຖ່າຍ

descripGrp.descrip: The panel item that opens the image editing tool that enables the user to apply a black and white effect.

termGrp.term: ເອັບ​ເຝັກ​ຂາວ​ດຳ

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that provides one-click filtering controls that make it easy to narrow down the portion of a data set that's being looked at.

termGrp.term: ເຄື່ອງ​ແຍກ​ອອກ

descripGrp.descrip: A miniature chart that can be inserted into text or embedded within a cell on a worksheet to illustrate highs, lows, and trends in your data.

termGrp.term: ເສັ້ນ​ປະ​ກາຍ

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that converts each slide in a presentation into a single image and rebuilds a new, compressed PPT presentation that can easily be shared, but not edited.

termGrp.term: ການ​ນຳ​ສະ​ເໜີ​ຮູບ

descripGrp.descrip: To gain access to all phone functionality by entering the correct password when the phone has locked itself due to delayed use or when the user has manually locked it.
A numeric keypad that is part of a device, is displayed on a device, or is in a computer program that you use to enter information in the context of a phone call.

An icon that is attached to an event and that is viewable in someone's calendar. Depending on the calendar view, a charm may appear next to an event title, or may be the only visual representation of an event on a calendar day.

termGrp.term: ຄວາມ​ດຶງ​ດູດ

descripGrp.descrip: The part of an e-mail address that identifies a user or an account on an e-mail system.

One of a group of photo modifications someone can make to a color photo that mimic different effects that would be achieved by taking the same photo using black and white film stock. One effect uses strict conversion to monochrome by throwing away all of the color information. Others mimic the result when a black and white photo is taken through a colored filter—orange, red, or yellow—to enhance or suppress certain color information. Two effects perform strict conversions to monochrome and then apply a color tint—sepia or cyan—in one step.

termGrp.term: ເອັບ​ເຝັກ​ຂາວ​ດຳ

descripGrp.descrip: A group of people someone communicates and shares with on Windows Live. Someone's network includes people they've added to their profile, to their Messenger contacts, or both. People in someone's network can see information about their latest activities in the what's new list, and may see other information, depending on permissions settings.
The navigational pane at the left of most webpages and Windows folders.

termGrp.term: ຖາດ​ເບື້ອງ​ຊ້າຍ

descripGrp.descrip: To permit someone else to perform an action. For example, to let someone else see your online status, send you messages, or see your public Messenger information.
A navigation button used to return to recently visited Web pages in Internet Explorer and other internet browsers.
The email address that forms the user name in a Microsoft account.

termGrp.term: ທີ່ຢູ່ອີເມວບັນຊີ Microsoft

descripGrp.descrip: Information that describes the current location of a computer. The location is entered manually in Default Location, and can be used by programs to determine the location of a computer when a location sensor is unavailable.

termGrp.term: ຈຸດ​ທີ່​ຕັ້ງ​ມາດ​ຕະ​ຖານ

descripGrp.descrip: A company that provides servers, Internet connectivity, and other associated facilities needed to publish websites.

termGrp.term: ແມ່​ຂ່າຍ​ເວັບ​ໄຊ​ທ໌

descripGrp.descrip: A mobile phone that can view web content by connecting directly to the Internet.

termGrp.term: ໂທ​ລະ​ສັບ​ມື​ຖື​ເປີດ​ໃຊ້​ງານ​ເວັບ

descripGrp.descrip: The heading for information about the time at which something was added, changed, or re-posted.

termGrp.term: ອັບ​ເດດ​ແລ້ວ

descripGrp.descrip: A number used as a unique identifier for each Windows Live ID holder. This number is disclosed to residents of the European Union to comply with EU privacy regulations.
An adjustment made to improve working order or efficiency.
A customizable page that launches with Windows Live Messenger and features a summary of news and weather, allows a customer to preview their Windows Live Mail inbox and search the Internet.
The title of the window in which the Windows Live Messenger Today page is displayed.
The part of a message header that contains the e-mail addresses of the primary recipients of an e-mail message.

termGrp.term: ແຖວ​ສົ່ງ​ເຖິງ

descripGrp.descrip: A text box where someone enters the e-mail addresses of the primary recipients of an e-mail message.

termGrp.term: ຫ້ອງ​ສົ່ງ​ເຖິງ

descripGrp.descrip: One of the two unlabeled keys located just below the display area on a mobile phone. These keys are called "soft" because their functions change to fit the context. Labels in the lower part of the mobile screen tell users what the soft keys do.
A feature of Windows Live Toolbar that provides additional information for particular kinds of text someone selects.

termGrp.term: ເມ​ນູ​ອັດ​ສະ​ລິ​ຍະ

descripGrp.descrip: To reveal or conceal information on a screen, such as webpage modules or details about a person.

termGrp.term: ສະ​ແດງ/ເຊື່ອງ

descripGrp.descrip: A set of features that enables users to improve the quality of their images with just one or two clicks. Galleries help the user optimize characteristics such as brightness, contrast, color, and sharpness.

termGrp.term: ການ​ແກ້​ໄຂ​ໃຫ້​ຖືກ​ຕ້ອງ

descripGrp.descrip: The button that enables someone to simultaneously send the messages they have composed and retrieve the new messages they've received.
A fraudulent business scheme; a swindle.
A feature in Live Search that provides answers to basic search queries, such as "What is the population of Mumbai?"
A feature that enables Tablet PC users to convert an ink drawing to a standard OfficeArt shape, which can be formatted with colors and effects exactly as if it were inserted using “Insert Shape.”

termGrp.term: ປ່ຽນ​ເປັນ​ຮູບ​ຮ່າງ

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that enables presenters to capture all the elements of a live presentation, including narration, slides, mouse clicks, A/V playback, and laser pointer highlights. The user can select which presentation aspects to record.

termGrp.term: ບັນ​ທຶກ​ສະ​ໄລ​ດ໌​ໂຊ

descripGrp.descrip: A map view created from aerial photos that shows buildings, roads, and geographical features.

termGrp.term: ພາບທາງອາກາດ

descripGrp.descrip: A slide show mode that displays content in a manageable window that can be resized and features navigation buttons. This mode is optimized for reviewing presentations, allowing users to get the full experience, complete with animations and media, while performing other tasks, such as taking notes.

termGrp.term: ມຸມມອງ​ການ​ອ່ານ

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that allows users to easily add links to content within other content (e.g. pages, sections, section groups) and provides quick navigation through these links. The feature operates in the same manner that links work in wikis.
A high-level linear representation of a project schedule that can be easily formatted, annotated, and copied and pasted from Project into other Office applications.

termGrp.term: ເສັ້ນ​ກຳ​ນົດ​ເວ​ລາ

descripGrp.descrip: A predefined collection of audio files (for example, songs) from a CD or digital download.
The street address or geographical coordinates of a user, and (by way of extensions) of the user’s computer or devices.

termGrp.term: ຈຸດທີ່ຕັ້ງ

descripGrp.descrip: To save the user's work on a continuous basis, so that it is not necessary to save manually.

termGrp.term: ບັນ​ທຶກ​ໂດຍ​ອັດ​ຕະ​ໂນ​ມັດ

descripGrp.descrip: A Microsoft Office Online application that enables users to upload, view (in full fidelity with animations and transitions maintained), share, and edit PPT files in a Web browser, as well as create basic presentations using only the Web client. They can also take those PPT presentations and embed them in other Web applications, like blog postings or other Web sites.
A gallery of effects that users can apply to images to create a customized, artistic look.
A specification according to which each open document occupies its own window in the UI, though only a single instance of the program application is running.
A view that allows users to read a document, but not to edit it.

termGrp.term: ມຸມມອງ​ການ​ອ່ານ

descripGrp.descrip: A view in Web Companions and Applications that is optimized for editing a document, and looks like the traditional document view in the client application (i.e. contains full Ribbon).

termGrp.term: ມຸມມອງ​ແກ້​ໄຂ

descripGrp.descrip: A feature that enables users to interact with back-end (LOB) data from within the Office Suite and SharePoint.
A question, usually from a drop-down list, that users can use to confirm their identity and reset their password in case they have forgotten it.
The message text box that is displayed on a contact's summary page.

termGrp.term: ສົ່ງ {ຊື່} ຂໍ້​ຄວາມ​ດ່ວນ

descripGrp.descrip: The link someone clicks to leave a brief note on someone else's profile.

The Microsoft online service that lets users access and share documents, photos, and other files from anywhere.

The Japanese kana characters that indicate the correct pronunciation, sorting, and grouping behavior of a word written in kanji. The name of a field that stores such characters and can impact the sorting/grouping behavior of a corresponding field that can contain a word written in kanji. Typically used to modify the kanji field’s name (e.g. “Yomi Last Name” specifies how to correctly pronounce/sort/group “Last Name”). The main distinction compared to “phonetic” is that sorting/grouping behavior is expected to be impacted for “yomi”, but not for “phonetic”.

The feature of Bing that enables customers to block sites containing adult (sexually explicit) content. Customers can choose from three levels of filtering: strict (hides adult text and image results); moderate (hides adult images only); and off (doesn't hide any search results).
The URL for Microsoft OneDrive.
A model of networked storage where data is stored in pools of storage that are virtualized from large data centers according to the requirements of the customer.

A text message thread between a group of people (usually more than 2). It allows you to keep all the replies from people in one thread, so that you can see the whole conversation.

descripGrp.descrip: A user account and associated credentials that is used to access Microsoft’s and 3rd parties’ business services, such as Office 365. Work or school accounts are usually assigned to end users by their organization (work, school, non-profit) and managed by the admin. However, some business services like Yammer support work or school accounts that were created by end users, without IT involvement. We sometimes refer to these accounts as “viral” AAD accounts but we don’t use this term externally. Work or school accounts are stored in Azure Active Directory (AAD) and managed by Microsoft on behalf of the organization. One of the key difference with a Microsoft account is that users don’t own the account and will typically loose access to it if they leave the organization. Other aspects like password policies are imposed by admins.

We sometimes refer to these accounts as “viral” AAD accounts but we don’t use this term externally. Work or school accounts are stored in Azure Active Directory (AAD) and managed by Microsoft on behalf of the organization.
